comment: For an integer not being 0 modulo a given prime number and a nonnegative integer less than the prime number, there is always a second nonnegative integer (less than the given prime number) so that the sum of this second nonnegative integer multiplied with the integer and the first nonnegative integer is 0 ( modulo the given prime number). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Nov-2018.)
